title: If there's a life after death, does it mean that we're dead? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your body is dead, but you aren't. Here's why I think so. After my daughter died I had communication with her. Things were said that could only have come from her, and others heard them as well. So I am convinced that there is an afterlife, at least for one person, my daughter. Read the whole story, which I call “an impeccable death,” here: Philosophy for Real Life (Philosophy for Real Life) And please read it. Don’t just assume that it must be wishful thinking or delusion without at least considering my story.

Given that there is life after death, then it means that there is no death and that what we call death is simply the transition to the next stage of life. It means the bodies die but that people (consciousness) do not. Death destroys forms and never life—life takes on a new form.
